```py
>>> import numpy as np
>>> from scipy import linalg
>>> rng = np.random.default_rng()
>>> a = rng.standard_normal((6, 9))
>>> r, q = linalg.rq(a)
>>> np.allclose(a, r @ q)
True
>>> r.shape, q.shape
((6, 9), (9, 9))
>>> r2 = linalg.rq(a, mode='r')
>>> np.allclose(r, r2)
True
>>> r3, q3 = linalg.rq(a, mode='economic')
>>> r3.shape, q3.shape
((6, 6), (6, 9)) 
```
